body.p: The script backup.sh can be used to take a backup of the swarm, UCP DTR and the DTR images in one go. You can pass this script an argument (tag) that will be used to prefix the backup filenames, thereby overriding the default naming. The following table shows the file names produced by backup.sh based on the argument passed in the command line.

row.entry: my_backup_swarm.tgz, my_backup_ucp.tgz, my_backup_dtr_meta.tgz, my_backup_dtr_data.tgz, and the corresponding .vars.tgz files

body.p: In addition, the backup.sh script accepts an optional switch that will let you specify the location of the password file that will be passed to the ansible-playbook commands in the script.
